abstracts.cdata!:
The scope of this environmental
            assessment, covers the adverse environmental impacts during
            construction of the Water Conservation Project, and of
            pesticides on soil, and groundwater, of dust and noise
            pollution, in addition to social impacts, agricultural
            production, and economy aspects. Mitigating measures suggest
            that, through the adoption of water-saving irrigation, water
            volumes will be reduced, and groundwater recharges will also
            be reduced, in particular, water leaching will not penetrate
            groundwater, which is the main cause of pesticide mobility.
            Although civil works will generate spoils, their impact will
            be reduced by back filling the excavated areas following
            pipe laying, and land leveling, and, water, and soil
            conservation, will be improved to optimize the medium, and
            low agricultural land yields. Dust pollution will be avoided
            during the windy dry period of Spring; similarly,
            construction works will be avoided during the rainy season,
            to control water and soil losses, and prevent excessive
            drainage. It is estimated that the project will improve the
            livelihoods of the local population, and the establishment
            of a water user authority will help improve management practices.
